place.name: HALLOUGHTON
place.gazetteerText: HALLOUGHTON, a parish in Southwell district, Notts; on an affluent of the river Trent, 1½ mile SSW of Southwell r. station. Post town, Southwell. Acres, 977. Real property, £, 406. Pop., 67. Houses, 15. The property is not much divided. The manor belongs to Sir John Sutton. There is a curious old mansion. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £46. Patron, the Bishop of Manchester. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
